Sharing some info for those planning to visit / work from here which could be useful. Just pointers. 

1. Download the Grab App for all your taxi + food delivery etc. Indian mobile + cards work seamless on the app 

2. All

Da Nang, Vietnam is unbelievably affordable 

For just $15/night, I get:
 Sea-facing hotel
 Free breakfast buffet
 Fast Wi-Fi
 Gym &  Pool access
 24/7 AC I control myself
 Well-maintained room with a working desk.

I think Vietnam is better than Bali.

Move to

Last month I visited Vietnam, and it's a workcation paradise. Here's why:

- E-Visa: $25
- Hostels/day: $3-$10
- Hotels/day: $10-$20
- Street Food: $1-$5
- Cafes/Restaurants: $5-$20
- Transport costs same as in India, sometimes cheaper

You don’t need to travel first world to experience first world quality of life.

This is Da Nang, Vietnam.

A city where 4 star hotels cost 2400 INR/night.

Instead of choosing Himachal or Goa for your next workcation, consider Vietnam.

You can live on a budget of under $500/month or upgrade to a more comfortable lifestyle at $800/month.

Yes sir. Saigon (cool museums ), Phu Quoc island (Chinese tourists), Hanoi and Ha Long Bay (must see). Was in Da Nang back in Feb/March this year when pollution in BKK was crazy. Dirt cheap, like $50/night 4 stars by the beach cheap.  Worst thing about it is the constant honking,

Solo traveled to Vietnam with zero plans, chose just one city — Da Nang — and it turned out to be the most peaceful, soulful vacation I’ve ever had. Vietnam is vast, but you don’t need to race across the country, if you are on time constraint, then opt for Da Nang. Here's why
